question:
You have lost an item of value on a train. Write a letter to the railway company. In your letter:
• describe the item 
• explain where and when you left it 
• say what action you would like the company to take
text: I, Kuljeet Kaur, resident of Ambala city, writing this letter to you to lodge a complaint regarding the loss of an item during my journey from Ambala to Delhi.

Last Monday, I had started my journey from the city railway station and I was carrying a laptop during that time. It was of black colour having a grey tag on its back and of brand Acer. This device belongs to my official property and contains office records as well as data.

I remember when I board the train, it was lying beside me. Before reaching the destination place I had seen it. As I was carrying a lot of luggage, due to that I forget to pick up the laptop and left it behind.

After that when I was travelling to my home then I realised that my laptop is not with me. I need to hand over this device to my office as it has all the mandatory information pertaining to our organization. Therefore, I request you to please ask the staff to locate it and hand it over to the station and make a call to me, so that I can collect it from there.
Look forward to hearing a positive reply from your side.
